title: Introduction to seededlda
text: use corpus Sputnik articles Ukraine examples. preprocessing, remove grammatical words stopwords("en"), email addresses "*@* words occur 10% documents max_docfreq = 0.1 document-feature matrix (DFM).
code: library(seededlda) library(quanteda)  corp <- readRDS("data_corpus_sputnik2022.rds") toks <- tokens(corp, remove_punct = TRUE, remove_symbols = TRUE,                 remove_numbers = TRUE, remove_url = TRUE) dfmt <- dfm(toks) |>      dfm_remove(stopwords("en")) |>     dfm_remove("*@*") |>     dfm_trim(max_docfreq = 0.1, docfreq_type = "prop") print(dfmt) #> Document-feature matrix of: 8,063 documents, 58,541 features (99.77% sparse) and 4 docvars. #>              features #> docs          reiterated commitment diplomacy worsened reporters urge best #>   s1092644731          1          1         8        1         2    1    1 #>   s1092643478          0          0         0        0         0    0    0 #>   s1092643372          0          0         0        0         0    0    0 #>   s1092643164          0          0         0        0         0    0    0 #>   s1092641413          0          0         6        0         0    0    0 #>   s1092640142          0          0         0        0         0    0    0 #>              features #> docs          forward continuing buildup #>   s1092644731       1          2       2 #>   s1092643478       0          0       0 #>   s1092643372       1          0       0 #>   s1092643164       0          0       0 #>   s1092641413       0          1       0 #>   s1092640142       0          0       0 #> [ reached max_ndoc ... 8,057 more documents, reached max_nfeat ... 58,531 more features ]

title: Introduction to seededlda
text: can fit LDA DFM setting number topics k = 10 identify. verbose = TRUE, shows progress inference iterations. takes long time fit LDA large corpus, distributed algorithm speed analysis dramatically.

title: Distributed LDA
text: batch_size = 0.01, distributed algorithm allocates 1% documents corpus processor. uses processors default, can limit number options(seededlda_threads). Despite much shorter execution time, identifies topic terms similar standard LDA.

title: Sequential LDA
text: use Sputnik corpus Ukraine, preparation example slightly different introduction. Since Sequential LDA created classification sentences, apply corpus_reshape() corpus segment texts result, DFM documents (150925) sentence number appended document names. sentences make sparsity DFM high (99.98%).
code: library(seededlda) library(quanteda) library(ggmatplot)  corp <- readRDS("data_corpus_sputnik2022.rds") |>     corpus_reshape(to = "sentences") toks <- tokens(corp, remove_punct = TRUE, remove_symbols = TRUE,                 remove_numbers = TRUE, remove_url = TRUE) dfmt <- dfm(toks) |>      dfm_remove(stopwords("en")) |>     dfm_remove("*@*") |>     dfm_trim(max_docfreq = 0.1, docfreq_type = "prop") print(dfmt) #> Document-feature matrix of: 150,925 documents, 58,838 features (99.98% sparse) and 4 docvars. #>                features #> docs            monday president joe biden reiterated united states commitment #>   s1092644731.1      1         1   1     1          1      1      1          1 #>   s1092644731.2      0         0   0     1          0      0      0          0 #>   s1092644731.3      0         2   0     1          0      0      0          0 #>   s1092644731.4      0         1   0     0          0      0      0          0 #>   s1092644731.5      0         0   0     0          0      0      0          0 #>   s1092644731.6      0         0   0     0          0      0      0          0 #>                features #> docs            diplomacy tensions #>   s1092644731.1         1        1 #>   s1092644731.2         1        0 #>   s1092644731.3         1        0 #>   s1092644731.4         1        0 #>   s1092644731.5         0        0 #>   s1092644731.6         0        0 #> [ reached max_ndoc ... 150,919 more documents, reached max_nfeat ... 58,828 more features ]

title: Sequential LDA
text: can enable sequential algorithm setting gamma = 0.5. value smaller , topics previous sentence affect less classifying current sentence.

what: Seeded Sequential LDA for Topic Modeling
title: Seeded Sequential LDA for Topic Modeling
text: seededlda R package implements Seeded LDA (Latent Dirichlet Allocation) semi-supervised topic modeling based quanteda. Initially, package simple wrapper around topicmodels package, fully rewritten C++ using GibbsLDA++ library submitted CRAN version 0.5 2020. package developed add sequential classification (Sequential LDA) parallel computing (Distributed LDA) capabilities released version 1.0 2023. keyATM latest addition semi-supervised topic models. users Seeded LDA also encouraged download package.

title: Optimize the number of topics — divergence
text: x LDA model fitted textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda(). min_size minimum size topics regularized topic divergence. Ignored regularize = FALSE. select names topics divergence computed. regularize TRUE, returns regularized divergence.

title: Optimize the number of topics — divergence
text: divergence() computes average Jensen-Shannon divergence pairs topic vectors x$phi. divergence score maximizes chosen number topic k optimal (Deveaud et al., 2014). regularized divergence penalizes topics smaller min_size avoid fragmentation (Watanabe & Baturo, forthcoming).

title: Unsupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_lda
text: Implements unsupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation (LDA). Users can run Seeded LDA setting gamma > 0.

title: Unsupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_lda
code: textmodel_lda(   x,   k = 10,   max_iter = 2000,   auto_iter = FALSE,   alpha = 0.5,   beta = 0.1,   gamma = 0,   model = NULL,   batch_size = 1,   verbose = quanteda_options("verbose") )

title: Unsupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_lda
text: x dfm model fit. k number topics. max_iter maximum number iteration Gibbs sampling. auto_iter TRUE, stops Gibbs sampling convergence reaching max_iter. See details. alpha value smooth topic-document distribution. beta value smooth topic-word distribution. gamma parameter determine change topics sentences paragraphs. gamma > 0, Gibbs sampling topics current document affected previous document's topics. model fitted LDA model; provided, textmodel_lda() inherits parameters existing model. See details. batch_size split corpus smaller batches (specified proportion) distributed computing; disabled batch include documents batch_size = 1.0. See details. verbose logical; TRUE print diagnostic information fitting.

title: Unsupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_lda
text: textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda() returns list model parameters. theta distribution topics documents; phi distribution words topics. alpha beta small constant added frequency words estimate theta phi, respectively, Gibbs sampling. elements list subject change.

title: Unsupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_lda
text: auto_iter = TRUE, iteration stops even max_iter delta <= 0. delta computed measure changes number words whose topics updated Gibbs sampler every 100 iteration shown verbose message. batch_size < 1.0, corpus partitioned sub-corpora ndoc(x) * batch_size documents Gibbs sampling sub-processes synchronization parameters every 10 iteration. Parallel processing efficient batch_size small (e.g. 0.01). algorithm Approximate Distributed LDA proposed Newman et al. (2009). User can changed number sub-processes used parallel computing via options(seededlda_threads). predict topics new documents (.e. --sample), first, create new LDA model existing LDA model passed model textmodel_lda(); second, apply topics() new model. model argument takes objects created either textmodel_lda() textmodel_seededlda().

title: Semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seededlda
text: Implements semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation (Seeded LDA). textmodel_seededlda() allows users specify topics using seed word dictionary. Users can run Seeded Sequential LDA setting gamma > 0.

title: Semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seededlda
code: textmodel_seededlda(   x,   dictionary,   levels = 1,   valuetype = c("glob", "regex", "fixed"),   case_insensitive = TRUE,   residual = 0,   weight = 0.01,   max_iter = 2000,   auto_iter = FALSE,   alpha = 0.5,   beta = 0.1,   gamma = 0,   batch_size = 1,   ...,   verbose = quanteda_options("verbose") )

title: Semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seededlda
text: x dfm model fit. dictionary quanteda::dictionary() seed words define topics. levels levels entities hierarchical dictionary used seed words. See also quanteda::flatten_dictionary. valuetype see quanteda::valuetype case_insensitive see quanteda::valuetype residual number undefined topics. named "" default, can changed via base::options(seededlda_residual_name). weight determines size pseudo counts given matched seed words. max_iter maximum number iteration Gibbs sampling. auto_iter TRUE, stops Gibbs sampling convergence reaching max_iter. See details. alpha value smooth topic-document distribution. beta value smooth topic-word distribution. gamma parameter determine change topics sentences paragraphs. gamma > 0, Gibbs sampling topics current document affected previous document's topics. batch_size split corpus smaller batches (specified proportion) distributed computing; disabled batch include documents batch_size = 1.0. See details. ... passed quanteda::dfm_trim restrict seed words based term document frequency. useful glob patterns dictionary match many words. verbose logical; TRUE print diagnostic information fitting.

title: Semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seededlda
text: Lu, Bin et al. (2011). "Multi-aspect Sentiment Analysis Topic Models". doi:10.5555/2117693.2119585. Proceedings 2011 IEEE 11th International Conference Data Mining Workshops. Watanabe, Kohei & Zhou, Yuan (2020). "Theory-Driven Analysis Large Corpora: Semisupervised Topic Classification UN Speeches". doi:10.1177/0894439320907027. Social Science Computer Review. Watanabe, Kohei & Baturo, Alexander. (2023). "Seeded Sequential LDA: Semi-supervised Algorithm Topic-specific Analysis Sentences". doi:10.1177/08944393231178605. Social Science Computer Review.

title: Semisupervised Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seededlda
code: # \donttest{ require(seededlda) require(quanteda)  corp <- head(data_corpus_moviereviews, 500) toks <- tokens(corp, remove_punct = TRUE, remove_symbols = TRUE, remove_number = TRUE) dfmt <- dfm(toks) %>%     dfm_remove(stopwords("en"), min_nchar = 2) %>%     dfm_trim(max_docfreq = 0.1, docfreq_type = "prop")  dict <- dictionary(list(people = c("family", "couple", "kids"),                         space = c("alien", "planet", "space"),                         moster = c("monster*", "ghost*", "zombie*"),                         war = c("war", "soldier*", "tanks"),                         crime = c("crime*", "murder", "killer"))) lda_seed <- textmodel_seededlda(dfmt, dict, residual = TRUE, min_termfreq = 10,                                 max_iter = 500) terms(lda_seed) #> title: Sequential Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seqlda
text: Implements Sequential Latent Dirichlet allocation (Sequential LDA). textmodel_seqlda() allows users classify sentences texts. considers topics previous document inferring topics currency document. textmodel_seqlda() shortcut equivalent textmodel_lda(gamma = 0.5). Seeded Sequential LDA textmodel_seededlda(gamma = 0.5).

title: Sequential Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seqlda
code: textmodel_seqlda(   x,   k = 10,   max_iter = 2000,   auto_iter = FALSE,   alpha = 0.5,   beta = 0.1,   batch_size = 1,   model = NULL,   verbose = quanteda_options("verbose") )

title: Sequential Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seqlda
text: x dfm model fit. k number topics. max_iter maximum number iteration Gibbs sampling. auto_iter TRUE, stops Gibbs sampling convergence reaching max_iter. See details. alpha value smooth topic-document distribution. beta value smooth topic-word distribution. batch_size split corpus smaller batches (specified proportion) distributed computing; disabled batch include documents batch_size = 1.0. See details. model fitted LDA model; provided, textmodel_lda() inherits parameters existing model. See details. verbose logical; TRUE print diagnostic information fitting.

title: Sequential Latent Dirichlet allocation — textmodel_seqlda
text: Du, Lan et al. (2012). "Sequential Latent Dirichlet Allocation". doi.org/10.1007/s10115-011-0425-1. Knowledge Information Systems. Watanabe, Kohei & Baturo, Alexander. (2023). "Seeded Sequential LDA: Semi-supervised Algorithm Topic-specific Analysis Sentences". doi:10.1177/08944393231178605. Social Science Computer Review.

title: Extract most likely topics — topics
text: topics() returns likely topics documents based theta parameter.

title: Extract most likely topics — topics
code: topics(x, min_prob = 0, select = NULL)

title: Extract most likely topics — topics
text: x LDA model fitted textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda() min_prob ignores topics probability lower value. select returns selected topic highest probability; specify names columns x$theta.

title: Extract most likely topics — topics
text: Users can access original matrix x$theta likelihood scores; run max.col(x$theta) obtain result topics(x).

title: Changes in v1.1.0
text: Remove uniform simplify computation seed word weights. Add levels argument better handle hierarchical dictionaries.

title: Changes in v1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-06-12 Fix error textmodel_seqlda() called. Save values Array object double avoid rounding error (#60).

title: Changes in v1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-05-31 Add auto_iter textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda() stop Gibbs sampling automatically max_iter reached. Add batch_size textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda() enable distributed LDA algorithm parallel computing.

title: Changes in v0.9.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-30 Add gamma parameter textmodel_seededlda() textmodel_lda() sequential classification. Add textmodel_seqlda() short cut textmodel_lda(gamma = 0.5). Improve calculation weights seed words. Add regularize argument divergence() regularized topic divergence measure.

title: Changes in v0.8.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-03-23 Fix deprecation Matrix 1.5-4.

title: Changes in v0.8.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-03-17 Add data_corpus_moviereviews package reduce dependency.

title: Changes in v0.8.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-09 Add min_prob select topics() greater flexibility Change divergence measure Kullback-Leibler Jensen-Shannon. Add weighted, min_size, select divergence() regularized topic divergence scores.

title: Changes in v0.8.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-28 Change textmodel_seededlda() set positive integer values residual. Fix bug textmodel_seededlda() ignores n-grams concatenator “_“. Change topics() return document names. Add divergence() optimize number topics seed words (#26).

title: Changes in v0.8.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-07 Add model argument textmodel_lda() replace predict().

title: Changes in v0.7.0
text: Change textmodel_seededlda object save dictionary related settings (#18)

title: Changes in v0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-04-08 Add predict() identify topics unseen documents (#9) Allow selecting seed words based frequencies using dfm_trim() textmodel_seededlda() via ... (#8)

title: Changes in v0.5.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-12-17 Change topics() return factor NA empty documents Fix bug initializing LDA leads incorrect phi (#4 #6)

title: Changes in v0.5
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-10 Implement original LDA estimator using LDAGibbs++ library
